default: (a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

features.name: Keeper Spells
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you always have the following spells prepared, and they don't count against your number of spells known:

items: 2nd Level: <spell spare the dying>, <spell cure wounds>, <spell life sap|ULDNecromancerClass>
3rd Level: <spell lesser restoration>, <spell aid>
5th Level: <spell aura of vitality>, <spell beacon of hope>
7th Level: <spell aura of life>, <spell aura of purity>
9th Level: <spell greater restoration>, <spell mass cure wounds>

features.name: Life on Demand
entries: As an action, you touch a willing creature. It expends one Hit Die, rolls it, and adds your Charisma modifier. It regains hit points equal to the total (minimum 1).
You can use this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (min 1). You regain all uses after a long rest.

features.name: Deliverer
entries: As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet is hit by a critical hit, you can turn it into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.
You can use this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (min 1). You regain all uses after a long rest.

features.name: Aura of Wellbeing
entries: When an undead starts its turn within 10 feet of you, you can grant it temporary HP equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.
You can also grant temp HP this way to any creature within 10 feet that starts its turn with half or fewer hit points remaining.

features.name: Master of Mending
entries: Whenever you roll dice to restore HP with a spell or Necromancer feature, use the maximum value of each die instead.
Necromancers of this Occult study death in order to keep it at bay. Keepers understand how and why creatures die, and how to prevent it.

features.name: Inevitability
entries: Whenever you target a creature with a Necromancy cantrip and miss with the attack roll or the target succeeds on a saving throw, the target takes half damage but no other effects.
Additionally, when you cast a Necromancy spell of 1st level or higher, add your proficiency bonus to one damage roll of that spell.

features.name: Improved Soul Harvest
entries: When you cast a Necromancy spell while you have temporary hit points, you can reduce your temporary hit points by up to twice your Charisma modifier.
Increase one damage roll of that spell by the amount of temporary hit points lost.

features.name: Necrosis Spellcasting
entries: Whenever you deal damage to one or more creatures with a Necromancy spell, choose one of the targets.
That creature takes an additional 1d8 necrotic damage, or 2d8 if the target is undead.

features.name: Grim Aura
entries: You emit an aura of death in a 10-foot radius while not incapacitated. Non-magical plants in this area wither.
Creatures of your choice in the aura can't regain hit points or become stable.
Once per turn, you can use a bonus action to target a creature within 30 feet. It must make a Constitution saving throw or become wreathed in miasma.
Until the end of the turn, the next time you damage that creature with a Necromancy spell, it is vulnerable to that damage.
You can use this once per long rest or expend a 4th-level spell slot or higher to use it again.

features.name: Spirit Well
entries: As an action, you can touch a corpse to create a Spirit Well with a 10 ft radius aura. The well can be moved by moving the corpse.
You choose the type of Spirit Well upon creation. Spirit Wells turn to ash after 1 minute or when destroyed (AC 8, 15 HP, immune to psychic and poison).
You can use this feature twice. Regain 1 use on a short rest, all on a long rest.
Wells available:

items: Well of Blindness: Forces CON save or blinded until end of turn.
Well of Hate: On damage, forces CON save or takes extra necrotic damage (1d10–4d10 scaling).
Well of Restrict: DEX save or treat aura as difficult terrain.
Well of Succor: Grants Half Cover.
Well of Terror: WIS save or frightened of the Well.
Well of Darkness (lvl 6): Area acts as <spell darkness>.
Well of Silence (lvl 6): Area acts as <spell silence>.
Well of Binding (lvl 10): CHA save or unable to leave aura.
Well of Fatigue (lvl 10): CON save or gain 1 level of exhaustion until outside the aura.
Well of Blood (lvl 14): End of turn, gain temp HP or take necrotic damage (1d6 + CHA).
Well of Fortune (lvl 14): Advantage on saves vs magic.
Well of Misfortune (lvl 14): Disadvantage on saves vs magic.

entries: Spirit Well saves use your Necromancer spell save DC. You or your Undead automatically succeed on these saves if affected.

features.name: Bloodbag Army
entries: As an action, choose one Undead you control and one willing creature within 30 ft of it.
The Undead drops to 0 HP. The willing creature regains the same amount of HP lost by the Undead.
Until your next turn, that creature has advantage on its next attack, ability check, or saving throw.

features.name: Walking Wells
entries: You can now turn your Undead into Spirit Wells. Touch one to apply a Spirit Well aura to it.
It remains animate and emits the effect for up to 1 minute or until reduced to 0 HP.
Your maximum number of Spirit Wells is now equal to your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Necrotic Pulse
entries: As a bonus action, choose one active Spirit Well within 120 ft. All creatures within 30 ft must make a CON save.
They take 6d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, half on a success. The Spirit Well is destroyed afterward.
You may choose to increase the aura of a Spirit Well you create to 30 feet.

features.name: Unholy Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to necrotic damage.
You become immune to spells and effects that reduce your hit point maximum or ability scores.

features.name: Improved Animation
entries: When you cast <spell animate dead>, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones to create an extra skeleton or zombie.
This does not apply when using Animate Major Undead.
Whenever you create an Undead with a Necromancy spell, you can grant it the following benefits:

items: HP maximum increased by your Charisma modifier.
Uses your spell attack modifier for its attack rolls.
Gains resistance to necrotic damage.
Is immune to effects that reduce HP maximum or ability scores.

features.name: Aura of Resolve
entries: Undead under your control within 30 ft gain the following:

items: Immunity to being Turned or Frightened.
Their attacks count as magical for overcoming resistances/immunities.
They gain a bonus to saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier.

features.name: Lord of the Undead
entries: When casting <spell animate dead>, you can raise a Ghoul instead of a Zombie, or a Toxotai instead of a Skeleton.
Undertakers are necromancers who focus on raising and improving Undead. They wield larger undead armies than most, and specialize in enhancing their durability and strength.
